timeline.bodyText: In the other languages, we ended up passing in a backupId as an argument. It would be good to do that here as well.
timeline.author: skuruppu
skuruppu
skuruppu
skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: Same as above for simplifying the code.
timeline.author: skuruppu
skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: I would remove this.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: I think the comment is sufficient and we can get rid of the println.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: I realize we have this type of comment in the createDatabase sample but I'm wondering if we could get rid of it here to keep things concise.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: In the other samples, we ended up listing all optimize operations so if you could remove the name filter that would be great. Hope it doesn't mess up the tests too much.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText:
I think to keep things simpler we can just do:
"Database %s restored from backup is %s%% optimized"
This is what we ended up doing in other languages. This way, you don't need to get the restoreDb or the restore info, etc.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: Can probably remove this too.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText:
I know this is how we defined it in the spec but we realized after that the samples tests won't be meaningful since these filter won't show anything. So we ended up doing the following:

Get the backup ID as input to listBackups and filter on name:backupId.
Database filter was changed to filter on the databaseId given as input.
Expire time filter was changed to expire_time < (time now + 30 days).
size_bytes > X where X depends on the size of the database you're creating in other parts of the test. PHP is using X = 500 and Node.js is using X = 100.
create_time >= (time now - 1 day)

Hope it's ok to make these changes.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: We ended up passing in the backupId as an argument in the other languages. Could we also do that here?
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText:
Are you hitting this in the samples tests because a single instance is shared? We didn't do this for other languages but I think that might be because we're creating and destroying an instance for each test run.
I'm a bit worried about the complexity of this in terms of a code sample since we just want to show users the simplest possible example.
timeline.author: skuruppu

replies.bodyText: Yep, the Java CI env runs two parallel tests (Java 8 and Java 11) on the same instance, so the restore operation would fail for one of them each time. What I could do is remove this error handling here and add it to the test case. That keeps the sample simple. The test will then run the sample repeatedly until it succeeds, fails with a different error than the expected error, or more than X attempts have failed with the 'more than X pending restores' error.
replies.author: olavloite

replies.bodyText: I've moved the retry logic away from the sample and into the test case.
replies.author: olavloite

timeline.bodyText: Same here, it would be good to get the backupId as an input.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: Same here regarding getting the backupId as in input.
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText:
We ended up checking the outputs (like the backupId in listbackups) in the tests for other languages. I don't know if that's conventional in the Java tests but would it be possible to do that here?
At least in Node.js, I found it helpful to know when we hadn't defined the types correctly and it printed out "undefined".
timeline.author: skuruppu

replies.bodyText: I've added checks for the backup ids in the logs for Java as well.
replies.author: olavloite

timeline.bodyText: I think it's better to check for "Updated backup [%s]".
timeline.author: skuruppu

timeline.bodyText: I think it would be good to test at least some of outputs with various filters. Let me know if you think it would be too flaky.
timeline.author: skuruppu

replies.bodyText: With the new filters, the output should now be predictable, so I've added checks to verify that the backup that was created is returned by all list operations.
replies.author: olavloite

timeline.message: fix: include db name in filter
fix: style + max 1 pending restore operation
fix: another try at fixing the error handling
fix: check for expected backup id in log
fix: verify that backup is found in list ops
fix: verify that backup is found in list ops
